page.title: 01West Bromwich
page.content: The twelve square kilometres are in reality two areas: one of high density housing, the other of open countryside. The river valley splits the area from north to south and acts as the route for a Motorway (M5) whilst another Motorway (M6) crosses the north of the area. The industrial decline of the area has meant the air becoming cleaner and the name 'Black Country' being less appropriate. The countryside of the valley provides a wildlife refuge as well as recreational facilities. It is a pity that the facilities offered by the valley often cost more than the residents surrounding it can afford to pay. People live in their villages even though the villages have joined together to form one conurbation. The optimistic outlook of the residents is natural even if foundationless.
